node.title: Australian Open: Kiwi doubles showdown ended by Sitak groin injury
node.description: Marcus Daniell is through to the second round, joining compatriot Michael Venus.
node.content: ["The Kiwi doubles battle at the Australian Open was cut short by injury, as Artem Sitak was forced to retire in his first round clash up against compatriot Marcus Daniell.", "In the first round of the men's doubles tournament, Daniell and partner Freddie Nielsen of Denmark were drawn against fellow New Zealander Sitak and Russia's Aslan Karatsev.", "Daniell and Nielsen took the first set 6-2, only for play to be hampered as Sitak suffered a groin injury.", "The 35-year-old had needed treatment at the end of the first set, but was unable to continue into a second and retired hurt.", "The win sees Daniell and Nielsen through to the second round, where they'll face the second seeded pair of Great Britain's Joe Salisbury and Rajeev Ram of the USA.", "Daniell is joined in the second round by another fellow Kiwi, and Olympic bronze medal winning partner Michael Venus.", "On Wednesday, sixth seeded Venus and partner Tim Putz of Germany defeated the American duo of Frances Tiafoe and Nicholas Monroe. Venus and Putz are drawn against Spain's Roberto Carballes Baena and France's Hugo Gaston.", "Venus is also taking part in the mixed doubles, and is through to the second round alongside another fellow Kiwi Erin Routliffe.", "The pair came back from a set down on Thursday, defeating Australians Lizette Cabrera and Alex Bolt 7-6 (5), 7-5, 13-11.", "Venus will face his men's doubles partner in the second round, with he and Routliffe drawn against the fourth seeded pairing of Putz and Alexa Guarachi."]
